#summary List of functions for the Python module


===a = new()===
makes a new empty area and returns an integer handle

===exists(a)===
returns True is the given area exists

===delete(a)===
deletes the given area

===add_point(a, span_type, x, y, cx, cy)===
adds a point to the given area

  span_type = 0 - for a line, or the start point, 1 for an anti-clockwise arc, -1 for a clockwise arc

  x, y = the point to add

  cx, cy = the centre point of the arc ( you can use any values here if span_type = 0 )

eg. add_point(a, 0, 10, 10, 0, 0)


===offset(a, inwards_value)===
offsets the given area inwards by inwards_value, or outwards if inwards value is negative
the round corners can be controlled with set_round_corner factor, see below

===set_round_corner_factor(factor)===
a value which determines if round corners are made when offsetting

for 90 degree corners

   use 1 for round corners

   use 1.5 for square corners


===copy(a1, a2)===
copies a1 to a2

  for example

    a2 = area.new()

    area.copy(a1, a2)


===add_curve(a_to, a_from, curve)===
add curve from a_from to a_to

	
===num_curves, num_vertices, get_vertex===
for getting the shape of a given area

example

    for curve in range(0, area.num_curves(a)):

        for vertex in range(0, area.num_vertices(a, curve)):

            sp, x, y, cx, cy = area.get_vertex(a, curve, vertex)
